alert.note: Alert for Tolland (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 04 at 5:26PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by earlier excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern Connecticut, including the following county, Tolland. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...The Willimantic River at Coventry was 8.17 feet which was above the flood stage of 8.0 feet. Other areas of small stream and creek flooding may be occurring too from the significant rainfall of the past 48 hours. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 521 PM EDT, Although the heavy rain has pushed to the south...3 to 6 inches of rain has fallen over the past 48 hours. Residual runoff may continue to result in some flooding on small streams and creeks. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mansfield, Coventry and Columbia. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
